dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, the big news this year, obviously, is vaccines. And it's pretty incredible how fast things are moving, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, the big news this year, obviously, is vaccines. And it's pretty incredible how fast things are moving, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. I mean, the speed and scale at which these vaccines are, like, reaching people, it's just extraordinary.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. I mean, the speed and scale at which these vaccines are, like, reaching people, it's just extraordinary.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The speed and scale at which vaccines are being provided is both extraordinary and necessary to end the pandemic...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really is. And a huge part of that global effort is COVAX, which, uh, was set up by the WHO and Gavi.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really is. And a huge part of that global effort is C O V A X, which, uh, was set up by the W H O and Gavi.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...COVAX, the central mechanism in the global COVID-19 vaccination effort, launched last year by the World Health Organization and Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they're aiming for, what, two billion doses over the next year? Like, for 190 countries, regardless of their ability to pay.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they're aiming for, what, two billion doses over the next year? Like, for one hundred ninety countries, regardless of their ability to pay.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: COVAX will facilitate the rollout of two billion vaccine doses over the next year, reaching people in 190 participating countries and economies, regardless of their ability to pay.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The goal is to protect all health and social care workers worldwide by mid-2021. Which, you know, that's a massive undertaking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The goal is to protect all health and social care workers worldwide by mid-twenty twenty one. Which, you know, that's a massive undertaking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, there should be enough doses to protect all health- and social-care workers worldwide by mid-2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but it's not all smooth sailing, is it? I mean, demand is just, [interrupts] uh, outstripping supply.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but it's not all smooth sailing, is it? I mean, demand is just, uh, outstripping supply.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet as vaccines have been rolled out, demand has predictably outpaced the still-limited supply.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] It absolutely is. And that creates this problem of "vaccine nationalism." We saw it with H1N1 back in 2009.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It absolutely is. And that creates this problem of vaccine nationalism. We saw it with H one N one back in two thousand nine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In tackling COVID-19, we must avoid a repeat of 2009, when a small number of rich countries bought up most of global supply of H1N1 flu vaccine, leaving the rest of the world with none.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Where, like, richer countries just bought up most of the supply, leaving others with nothing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Where, like, richer countries just bought up most of the supply, leaving others with nothing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...when a small number of rich countries bought up most of global supply of H1N1 flu vaccine, leaving the rest of the world with none.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. And COVAX was specifically created to prevent that from happening again. Because if we only vaccinate some people in some countries, the pandemic just keeps going.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. And C O V A X was specifically created to prevent that from happening again. Because if we only vaccinate some people in some countries, the pandemic just keeps going.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vaccine nationalism is precisely the problem that COVAX was created to solve. ... To end the cycle, we cannot vaccinate only some people in some countries; we must protect all people everywhere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, um, but we're still seeing countries making bilateral deals, right? Like, some even buying more doses than they actually need?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, um, but we're still seeing countries making bilateral deals, right? Like, some even buying more doses than they actually need?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...it is no surprise that some 35 countries have already concluded bilateral deals with pharmaceutical manufacturers for COVID-19 vaccines. ... Unfortunately, we are already seeing some governments buy far more doses than they need...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, unfortunately. But the article points out that COVAX is flexible enough to work around that, especially if those countries donate their surplus through, like, the Gavi/COVAX AMC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, unfortunately. But the article points out that C O V A X is flexible enough to work around that, especially if those countries donate their surplus through, like, the Gavi C O V A X A M C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although COVAX is flexible enough to work around this particular problem... The best way to ensure that they are is for donor governments to go through the Gavi/COVAX Advance Market Commitment (AMC) mechanism...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so that's the mechanism that ensures doses get to those 92 low- and middle-income countries?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so that's the mechanism that ensures doses get to those ninety two low- and middle-income countries?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the Gavi/COVAX Advance Market Commitment (AMC) mechanism, which was created to ensure that COVID-19 vaccines are made available to people living in the worlds 92 low- and middle-income countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. COVAX has already secured a billion doses for them, which is great, but obviously, many more are needed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. C O V A X has already secured a billion doses for them, which is great, but obviously, many more are needed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, COVAX has secured around one billion doses for people in these countries... But many more doses are needed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And manufacturers really need to step up, too, right? Make their vaccines available and affordable to COVAX.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And manufacturers really need to step up, too, right? Make their vaccines available and affordable to C O V A X.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All manufacturers must step up and make their vaccines available and affordable to COVAX, so that there can be a timely global rollout.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's a global effort. And, you know, the US just allocated four billion dollars to Gavi in its relief package, which is a huge boost for COVAX funding.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's a global effort. And, you know, the U S just allocated four billion dollars to Gavi in its relief package, which is a huge boost for C O V A X funding.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...in December, the United States allocated $4 billion for Gavi in its second COVID-19 relief package.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's pretty significant. So, it sounds like COVAX is working, but it needs continued, strong international support to actually finish the job.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's pretty significant. So, it sounds like C O V A X is working, but it needs continued, strong international support to actually finish the job.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All COVAX needs now is enough international support to finish the job.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. I mean, we've gone from no vaccine to multiple approved ones in a year. Now it's just about making sure everyone, everywhere, has access.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. I mean, we've gone from no vaccine to multiple approved ones in a year. Now it's just about making sure everyone, everywhere, has access.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Back in February, few imagined that by years end we would have more than one approved vaccine...
